item.title: CAPECITABINE
item.description:
DrugBank ID: db01101
DrugCentral: capecitabine
Synonymous :(1-(5-deoxy-beta-d-ribofuranosyl)-5-fluoro-1,2-dihydro-2-oxo-4-pyrimidinyl)-carbamic acid pentyl ester | capecitabin | capecitabina | capecitabine | capécitabine | capecitabinum | pentyl [1-(5-deoxy-β-d-ribofuranosyl)-5-fluoro-2-oxo-1,2-dihydropyrimidin-4-yl]carbamate | pentyl 1-(5-deoxy-β-d-ribofuranosyl)-5-fluoro-1,2-dihydro-2-oxo-4-pyrimidinecarbamate


Drug Sentece Context


Table 1. Analysis of context sentence of capecitabine gene in 2 abstracts.

pmid sentence
15084390 The CALGB performed a phase II multicenter study to evaluate the activity of oral capecitabine in patients with malignant mesothelioma (CALGB 39807). […] Capecitabine was administered at 2500 mg/m(2) per day divided in two doses for 14 days followed by a seven-day break. […] The antitumor activity of capecitabine is insufficient to warrant further exploration in patients with malignant mesothelioma.
16472713 Responses have also been observed in a moderate proportion of patients who had been pretreated with anthracyclines, taxanes, and capecitabine.
25670260 The patient was administered radiation plus chemotherapy, which included cisplatin and capecitabine.
28140044 Responses have also been observed in a moderate proportion of patients who had been pretreated with anthracyclines, taxanes, and capecitabine.
